question: For the online platform, which interpretation best reflects what can (and cannot) be inferred from the 100% stacked bar chart?

options.A: Q1 has the highest number of online searches compared to the other quarters.
options.B: The sum of clicks and searches indicates user satisfaction trends across the year.
options.C: Complaints received are greater than online searches for every quarter.
options.D: Q4 has the highest number of advertisements clicked compared to the other quarters.

explanation: 100% stacking normalizes unrelated categories (clicks, complaints, searches) to 100% within each quarter. Valid inferences include within-quarter ranking (e.g., complaints > searches in every quarter). Invalid inferences include cross-quarter total comparisons or combining unrelated categories.
